snippet: It appears that as many as six of the attackers identified in the Paris massacre were Europeans who traveled to fight and train in Syria before returning home.
abstract: Details emerging from investigations of deadly Paris terrorist attacks indicate that siege was orchestrated by young European Muslims who had already been flagged by officials after travels to Islamic State-controlled territories; revelations cast doubt on abilities of European security forces to prevent further attacks by extremists; chart depicts connections between suspects in Paris attacks as they are known to authorities.

byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky contributed reporting from Paris, and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: It appears that as many as six of the attackers identified in the Paris massacre were Europeans who traveled to fight and train in Syria before returning home.

headline.main: Paris Attacks Highlight Jihadists’ Easy Path Between Europe and ISIS Territory
headline.print_headline: Assaults Highlight Jihadists’ Easy Path to Syria and Back

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
